example: 单词 contingent 的例句||||The contingent marched in the direction of the Western Hills. 队伍朝西山的方向前进。||||Whether or not we arrive on time is contingent on the weather. 我们是否按时到达要视天气情况而定。

name: credentials
example: 单词 credentials 的例句||||He has long credentials of diplomatic service. 他的外交工作资历很深。||||Both candidates for the job have excellent credentials. 此项工作的两个求职者都非常符合资格。

name: purge
interpret: n.整肃，清除，泻药，净化；vt.净化，清除，摆脱；vi.清除，通便，腹泻，变得清洁
example: 单词 purge 的例句||||The new president carried out a purge of disloyal army officers. 新总统对不忠诚的军官进行了清洗。|||| The mayoral candidate has promised to purge the police department. 市长候选人答应清洗警察部门。

name: twig
example: 单词 twig 的例句||||He heard the sharp crack of a twig. 他听到树枝清脆的断裂声。||||The sharp sound of a twig snapping scared the badger away. 细枝突然折断的刺耳声把獾惊跑了。

name: synonym
example: 单词 synonym 的例句||||Zhuge Liang is a synonym for wisdom in folklore. 诸葛亮在民间传说中成了智慧的代名词。||||The term 'industrial democracy' is often used as a synonym for worker participation. “工业民主”这个词常被用作“工人参与”的同义词。

name: affordable
interpret: adj.支付得起的，不太昂贵的
example: 单词 affordable 的例句||||The rent for the four-roomed house is affordable. 四居室房屋的房租付得起。||||There are few affordable apartments in big cities. 在大城市中没有几所公寓是便宜的。

name: eradicate
example: 单词 eradicate 的例句||||These insects are very difficult to eradicate. 这些昆虫很难根除。||||They are already battling to eradicate illnesses such as malaria and tetanus. 他们已经在努力消灭疟疾、破伤风等疾病。

name: amendment
example: 单词 amendment 的例句||||The amendment was rejected by 207 voters to 143. 这项修正案以207票对143票被否决。||||The Opposition has tabled an amendment to the bill. 反对党已经就该议案提交了一项修正条款。

name: uneven
interpret: adj.不平坦的，不规则的，不均匀的
example: 单词 uneven 的例句||||The sidewalk is very uneven-be careful where you walk. 这人行道凹凸不平——走路时请小心。||||The country was noted for its uneven distribution of land resources. 这个国家以土地资源分布不均匀出名。

name: tonic
interpret: n./adj.滋补品，补药，强身的，健体的
example: 单词 tonic 的例句||||It will be marketed as a tonic for the elderly. 这将作为老年人滋补品在市场上销售。||||Sea air is Nature's best tonic for mind and body. 海上的空气是大自然赋予的对人们身心的最佳补品。

name: stagnant
interpret: adj.不流动的，停滞的，不景气的
example: 单词 stagnant 的例句||||Due to low investment, industrial output has remained stagnant. 由于投资少，工业生产一直停滞不前。||||Their national economy is stagnant. 他们的国家经济停滞不前。

name: stipulate
interpret: vt.规定，（作为条件）讲定，保证
example: 单词 stipulate 的例句||||International rules stipulate the number of foreign entrants. 国际规则规定了外国参赛者的人数。|||| Some manufacturers stipulate the price at which their goods are to be sold. 有些制造商规定出售他们生产的商品的价格。

name: sluggish
interpret: adj.懒惰的，迟钝的，无精打采的
example: 单词 sluggish 的例句||||This humid heat makes you feel rather sluggish. 这种湿热的天气使人感到懒洋洋的。||||Circulation is much more sluggish in the feet than in the hands. 脚部的循环比手部的循环缓慢得多。

name: secular
interpret: n.牧师，凡人；adj.世俗的，现世的，不朽的
example: 单词 secular 的例句||||We live in an increasingly secular society. 我们生活在一个日益非宗教的社会。||||Britain is a plural society in which the secular predominates. 英国是个世俗主导的多元社会。

name: scrupulous
interpret: adj.审慎的，小心翼翼的，完全的，纯粹的
example: 单词 scrupulous 的例句||||She is scrupulous to a degree. 她非常谨慎。||||Poets are not so scrupulous as you are. 诗人并不像你那样顾虑多。

name: exalt
interpret: vt. 提升；提拔；赞扬；使得意 vi. 使人得意
example: 单词 exalt 的例句||||She thanked the President to exalt her. 她感谢总统提拔她。||||His work exalts all those virtues that we, as Americans, are taught to hold dear. 他的作品颂扬了所有那些身为美国人应该珍视的美德。

name: grotesque
interpret: adj.怪诞的，丑陋的；n.怪诞的图案，怪人（物）
example: 单词 grotesque 的例句||||His face has a grotesque appearance. 他的面部表情十分怪。||||Her account of the incident was a grotesque distortion of the truth. 她对这件事的陈述是荒诞地歪曲了事实。

name: buckle
interpret: n.扣子，带扣；v.把...扣住，由于压力而弯曲
example: 单词 buckle 的例句||||The two ends buckle at the back. 带子两端在背后扣起来。||||She found it hard to buckle down. 她很难专心做一件事情。

name: align
interpret: vt.使成一线，结盟，调节；vi.成一线，结盟
example: 单词 align 的例句||||Align the ruler and the middle of the paper. 使尺子与纸张的中部成一条直线。||||There are signs that the Prime Minister is aligning himself with the liberals. 有迹象表明首相正在与自由党人结盟。

name: banal
example: 单词 banal 的例句||||Making banal remarks was one of his bad habits. 他的坏习惯之一就是喜欢说些陈词滥调。||||The allegations ranged from the banal to the bizarre. 从平淡无奇到离奇百怪的各种说法都有。

name: astronomical
example: 单词 astronomical 的例句||||He was an expert on ancient Chinese astronomical literature. 他是研究中国古代天文学文献的专家。|||| Houses in the village are selling for astronomical prices. 乡村的房价正在飙升。

name: onset
interpret: n.进攻，袭击，开始，突然开始
example: 单词 onset 的例句||||The drug must be taken from the onset of the infection. 这种药必须在感染的最初期就开始服用。|||| Our troops withstood the onset of the enemy. 我们的部队抵挡住了敌人的进攻。

name: communal
interpret: adj.公有的，公共的，公社的，公社制的
example: 单词 communal 的例句||||There was a communal toilet on the landing for the four flats. 在楼梯平台上有一处公共卫生间供4套公寓使用。||||The toilets and other communal facilities were in a shocking state. 厕所及其他公共设施的状况极其糟糕。

name: outrageous
interpret: adj.无理的，令人不能容忍的
example: 单词 outrageous 的例句||||Her outrageous behaviour at the party offended everyone. 她在聚会上的无礼行为触怒了每一个人。|||| Charges for local telephone calls are particularly outrageous. 本地电话资费贵得出奇。

name: vista
example: 单词 vista 的例句||||From my bedroom window I looked out on a crowded vista of hills and rooftops. 我从卧室窗口望去，远处尽是连绵的山峦和屋顶。||||These uprisings come from desperation and a vista of a future without hope. 发生这些暴动是因为人们被逼上了绝路，未来看不到一点儿希望。

name: feign
example: 单词 feign 的例句||||He used to feign an excuse. 他惯于伪造口实。||||She knew that her efforts to feign cheerfulness weren't convincing. 她明白自己强作欢颜是瞒不了谁的。

name: maze
example: 单词 maze 的例句||||He found his way through the complex maze of corridors. 他穿过了迷宮一样的走廊。||||She was lost in the maze for several hours. 一连几小时，她的头脑处于一片糊涂状态。

name: renewal
interpret: adj.(契约)延期，续订，更新，复活，重来
example: 单词 renewal 的例句||||Her contract is coming up for renewal in the autumn. 她的合同秋天就应该续签了。||||Easter eggs symbolize the renewal of life. 复活蛋象征新生。

name: lateral
example: 单词 lateral 的例句||||An airfoil that controls lateral motion. 能够控制横向飞行的机翼。||||Mr. Dawson walked into the court from a lateral door. 道森先生从一个侧面的门走进法庭。

name: fumble
interpret: vi.笨拙地用手摸、弄、接等，摸索
example: 单词 fumble 的例句||||His awkwardness made him fumble with the key. 由于尴尬不安，他拿钥匙开锁时显得笨手笨脚。||||He fumbled his one-handed attempt to light his cigarette. 他笨拙地想用一只手点燃香烟。

name: folly
interpret: n.愚笨，愚蠢，蠢事，蠢行，傻话
example: 单词 folly 的例句||||Learn wisdom by the folly of others. 从别人的愚蠢行动中学到智慧。||||Events proved the folly of such calculations. 事情的进展证明了这种估计是愚蠢的。

name: absolve
example: 单词 absolve 的例句||||I absolve you, on the ground of invincible ignorance. 鉴于你不可救药的无知，我原谅你。||||They agree to absolve you from your obligation. 他们同意免除你的责任。

name: sabotage
interpret: n.怠工，破坏活动，破坏；v.从事破坏活动，妨害，破坏
example: 单词 sabotage 的例句||||They tried to sabotage my birthday party. 他们企图破坏我的生日晚会。||||The fire at the factory was caused by sabotage. 那家工厂的火灾是有人蓄意破坏引起的。

name: oblivious
interpret: adj.易忘的，遗忘的，忘却的，健忘的
example: 单词 oblivious 的例句||||Mother has become quite oblivious after the illness. 这次病后，妈妈变得特别健忘。||||He was quite oblivious of the danger. 他完全没有察觉到危险。

name: rugged
interpret: adj.高低不平的，粗糙的，粗壮的，强健的
example: 单词 rugged 的例句||||Football players must be rugged. 足球运动员必须健壮。||||The Rocky Mountains have rugged mountains and roads. 落基山脉有崇山峻岭和崎岖不平的道路。

name: meddle
example: 单词 meddle 的例句||||I hope he doesn't try to meddle in my affairs. 我希望他不来干预我的事情。||||Do not meddle in things that do not concern you. 别参与和自己无关的事。

name: maxim
example: 单词 maxim 的例句||||Please lay the maxim to your heart. 请把此格言记在心里。||||"Waste not, want not" is her favourite maxim. “不浪费则不匮乏”是她喜爱的格言。

name: lucid
interpret: adj.明白易懂的，清晰的，头脑清楚的
example: 单词 lucid 的例句||||His explanation was lucid and to the point. 他的解释扼要易懂。||||He wasn't very lucid, he didn't quite know where he was. 他神志不是很清醒，不太知道自己在哪里。

name: legislative
interpret: n.立法机构，立法权；adj.立法的，有立法权的
example: 单词 legislative 的例句||||Congress is the legislative branch of the U. S. government. 国会是美国政府的立法部门。||||Today's hearing was just the first step in the legislative process. 今天的听证会只是展开立法程序的第一步。

name: lawful
interpret: adj.法律许可的，守法的，合法的
example: 单词 lawful 的例句||||It is not lawful to park in front of a hydrant. 在消火栓前停车是不合法的。||||We don't recognised him to be the lawful heir. 我们不承认他为合法继承人。

name: liaison
interpret: n.联系，（未婚男女间的）暖昧关系，私通
example: 单词 liaison 的例句||||She acts as a liaison between patients and staff. 她在病人与医护人员间充当沟通的桥梁。||||She is responsible for liaison with researchers at other universities. 她负责与其他大学的研究人员联系。

name: innovate
interpret: vi. 创新；改革；革新 vt. 改变；创立；创始；引人
example: 单词 innovate 的例句||||We must innovate in order to make progress. 我们必须改革以便取得进步。||||It is necessary to innovate and develop military theories. 创新和发展军事理论是必要的。

name: infringe
interpret: vt. 侵犯；违反；破坏 vi. 侵犯；侵害
example: 单词 infringe 的例句||||The jury ruled that he had infringed no rules. 陪审团裁决他没有违反任何规定。||||He occasionally infringe the law by parking near a junction. 他因偶尔将车停放在交叉口附近而违反规定。

name: haphazard
interpret: adj.无计划的，随意的，杂乱无章的
example: 单词 haphazard 的例句||||The town grew in a haphazard way. 这城镇无计划地随意发展。||||He regrerted his haphazard remarks. 他悔不该随口说出那些评论话。

name: glimmer
interpret: vi.发出闪烁的微光；n.微光，微弱的闪光
example: 单词 glimmer 的例句||||I looked at her and felt a glimmer of hope. 我注视她，感到了一线希望。||||A glimmer of amusement showed in her eyes. 她的眼中露出一丝笑意。

name: genial
interpret: adj.亲切的，和蔼的，愉快的，脾气好的
example: 单词 genial 的例句||||Orlando is a genial man. 奥兰多是一位和蔼可亲的人。||||He was a warm-hearted friend and genial host. 他是个热心的朋友，也是友善待客的主人。

name: franchise
interpret: n.特许，特权，专营权，特许权
example: 单词 franchise 的例句||||Catering in the schools is run on a franchise basis. 学校餐饮服务以特许权经营。||||The United States granted the franchise to women in 1920. 美国于1920年给妇女以参政权。

name: fixed
interpret: adj.固定的，不变的，准备好的；(计算机)固定的
example: 单词 fixed 的例句||||Have you two fixed on a date for the wedding yet? 你们俩选定婚期了吗？||||Once the aim is fixed, we should not change it arbitrarily. 目标一旦确定，我们就不应该随意改变。

name: feudal
example: 单词 feudal 的例句||||Feudal rulers ruled over the country several thousand years. 封建统治者统治这个国家几千年。|||| The feudal system lasted for two thousand years in China. 封建制度在中国延续了两千年之久。

name: fervent
example: 单词 fervent 的例句||||It was a debate which aroused fervent ethical arguments. 那是一场引发强烈的伦理道德争论的辩论。|||| Austria was among the most fervent supporters of Adolf Hitler. 奥地利是阿道夫希特勒最狂热的支持者之一。

name: exhale
interpret: vt. 呼气；发出；发散；使蒸发 vi. 呼气；发出；发散
example: 单词 exhale 的例句||||Sweet odours exhale from flowers. 花儿散发出花香。||||Wade exhaled a cloud of smoke and coughed. 韦德吐出一口烟，然后咳嗽起来。

name: exasperate
interpret: vt.激怒，使（疾病）加剧，使恶化
example: 单词 exasperate 的例句||||He shouted in an exasperate voice. 他以愤怒的声音嚷着。||||The sheer futility of it all exasperates her. 它毫无用处，这让她很生气。

name: entrust
example: 单词 entrust 的例句||||I couldn't entrust my children to strangers. 我不能把孩子交给陌生人照看。||||They can be entrusted to solve major national problems. 可以委托他们解决重大国家问题。

name: emancipate
example: 单词 emancipate 的例句||||This new machine will emancipate us from the hard work. 这部新机器将把我们从繁重劳动中解放出来。||||To emancipate all mankind, we will balk at no sacrifice, even that of our lives. 为了全人类的解放,即使牺牲生命也在所不惜。

name: eldest
example: 单词 eldest 的例句||||The King's eldest son is the heir to the throne. 国王的长子是王位的继承人。||||The castle and the land are entailed on the eldest son. 城堡和土地限定由长子继承。

name: sarcasm
example: 单词 sarcasm 的例句||||His sarcasm hurt her feelings. 他的讽刺伤害了她的感情。||||She was given to using bitter sarcasm. 她惯于用尖酸刻薄语言挖苦人。

name: sanitary
interpret: adj.卫生方面的，卫生的，清洁的，卫生的
example: 单词 sanitary 的例句||||It's not sanitary to let flies come near food. 让苍蝇接近食物是不卫生的。||||The sanitary conditions in this restaurant are abominable. 这家饭馆的卫生状况糟透了。

name: revival
interpret: n.复兴，复苏，（精力、活力等的）重振
example: 单词 revival 的例句||||The period saw a great revival in the wine trade. 这一时期葡萄酒业出现了很大的复苏。||||He claimed the housing market was showing signs of a revival. 他指出房地产市场正出现复苏的迹象。

name: reverence
interpret: n.敬畏，尊敬，尊严；Reverence:对某些基督教神职人员的尊称；v.尊敬，敬畏，崇敬
example: 单词 reverence 的例句||||He was a bishop who was held in reverence by all. 他是一位被大家都尊敬的主教。||||We reverence tradition but will not be fettered by it. 我们尊重传统，但不被传统所束缚。

name: remittance
example: 单词 remittance 的例句||||Your last month's salary will be paid by remittance. 最后一个月的薪水将通过汇寄的方式付给你。||||A prompt remittance would be appreciated. 速寄汇款不胜感激。

name: remit
interpret: vt. 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状 vi. 汇款；缓和 n. 移交的事物
example: 单词 remit 的例句||||I hope you'll remit me the money in time. 我希望你能及时把钱汇寄给我。||||Many immigrants regularly remit money to their families. 许多移民定期给他们的家人汇款。

name: reimburse
example: 单词 reimburse 的例句||||We'll reimburse you for your travelling expenses. 我们将付还你旅费。||||The funds are supposed to reimburse policyholders in the event of insurer failure. 这项基金将在保险公司不能偿付的情况下对投保人进行赔付。

name: rebate
interpret: vt. 减少；打折扣 vi. 退还部分付款，打折扣 n. 折扣
example: 单词 rebate 的例句||||You can claim a rebate on your tax. 你可以要求退回部分税款。||||Customers are to benefit from a rebate on their electricity bills. 顾客将从他们的电费退费中得到实惠。

name: reactionary
interpret: n.反动者，反动主义者；adj.反动的，反动主义的，反对改革的
example: 单词 reactionary 的例句||||They forced thousands of peasants into their reactionary armies. 他们迫使成千上万的农民参加他们的反动军队。||||The reactionary ruling clique was torn by internal strife. 反动统治集团内部勾心斗角，四分五裂。

name: protrude
interpret: vt. 使突出，使伸出 vi. 突出，伸出
example: 单词 protrude 的例句||||The tip of her tongue was protruding slightly. 她的舌尖微微伸出。||||A huge round mass of smooth rock protruding from the water. 一块光滑的巨型圆石露出水面。

name: protocol
interpret: n.议定书，草约，会谈记录，外交礼节
example: 单词 protocol 的例句||||We must observe the correct protocol. 我们必须遵守应有的礼仪。||||The statesmen signed a protocol. 那些政治家签了议定书。

name: playwright
example: 单词 playwright 的例句||||Gwyn Thomas was a famous playwright. 格温·托马斯是著名的剧作家。||||The playwright was slaughtered by the press. 这位剧作家受到新闻界的无情批判。

name: pickpocket
example: 单词 pickpocket 的例句||||The pickpocket pinched her purse and ran away. 扒手偷了她的皮夹子跑了。||||He had his purse stolen by a pickpocket. 他的钱包被掏了。

name: pawn
interpret: n.典当，抵押，小人物，走卒；v.典当，抵押
example: 单词 pawn 的例句||||He is contemplating pawning his watch. 他正在考虑抵押他的手表。||||It looks as though he is being used as a political pawn by the President. 看起来他似乎被总统当作了政治卒子。

name: par
interpret: n.标准，票面价值，平均数量；adj.票面的，平常的，标准的
example: 单词 par 的例句||||Sales of nylon have been below par in recent years. 近年来尼龙织品的销售额一直不及以往。||||I don't think his ability is on a par with yours. 我认为他的能力不能与你的能力相媲美。

name: onlooker
example: 单词 onlooker 的例句||||A handful of onlookers stand in the field watching. 少数几个旁观者站在现场观看。||||One onlooker had to be restrained by police. 一个旁观者遭到了警察的制止。

name: ominous
interpret: adj.不祥的，不吉的，预兆的，预示的
example: 单词 ominous 的例句||||Those black clouds look ominous for our picnic. 那些乌云对我们的野餐来说是个不祥之兆。||||There was an ominous silence at the other end of the phone. 电话那头出现了不祥的沉默。

name: notary
example: 单词 notary 的例句||||She is the town clerk and a certified public accountant and notary public. 她身兼城镇文书、执业会计师和公证人数职。||||That notary is authorised to perform the certain legal functions. 公证人被授权执行某些法律职能。

name: morbid
interpret: adj.病的；致病的；病态的；可怕的
example: 单词 morbid 的例句||||Some people have a morbid fascination with crime. 一些人对犯罪有一种病态的痴迷。||||It's morbid to dwell on cemeteries and such like. 不厌其烦地谈论墓地以及诸如此类的事是一种病态。

name: militia
example: 单词 militia 的例句||||First came the PLA men, then the people's militia. 人民解放军走在前面，其次是民兵。||||There's a building guarded by the local militia at the corner of the street. 街道拐角处有一幢由当地民兵团守卫的大楼。

name: wane
interpret: n.衰微，亏缺，变弱；v.变小，亏缺，呈下弦
example: 单词 wane 的例句||||The moon is on the wane. 月亮渐亏。||||Her enthusiasm for him was beginning to wane. 她对他的热情在开始减退。

name: brilliance
interpret: n.光辉，辉煌，壮丽，（卓越的）才华，才智
example: 单词 brilliance 的例句||||I was totally amazed by the brilliance of her paintings. 她的绘画才能令我惊歎不已。||||The gorgeous costume added to the brilliance of the dance. 华丽的服装使舞蹈更加光彩夺目。

name: obligatory
interpret: adj.强制性的，义务的，必须的
example: 单词 obligatory 的例句||||It is obligatory for us to obey the laws. 我们必须守法。||||It is obligatory on every citizen to safeguard our great motherland. 保卫我们伟大的祖国是每一个公民应尽的义务。

name: mentality
example: 单词 mentality 的例句||||He has many years' experience of the criminal mentality. 他研究犯罪心理有多年经验。||||Running a business requires a very different mentality from being a salaried employee. 经营企业所要求具备的心态和上班族的心态截然不同。

name: clench
interpret: vt.捏紧（拳头等），咬紧（牙齿等），紧紧握住
example: 单词 clench 的例句||||I clenched the arms of my chair. 我死死抓住椅子扶手。||||Slowly, he released his breath through clenched teeth. 他从紧咬的牙缝间慢慢地舒了口气。

name: dwindle
interpret: vi. 减少；变小 vt. 使缩小，使减少
example: 单词 dwindle 的例句||||The factory's workforce has dwindled from over 4,000 to a few hundred. 工厂雇员总数已经从4,000多人减少到几百人。||||He is struggling to come to terms with his dwindling authority. 他正努力适应自己权力被削弱这一局面。

name: lengthy
example: 单词 lengthy 的例句||||We devoted a lengthy and full discussion to this topic. 我们对这个题目进行了长时间的充分讨论。||||The professor wrote a lengthy book on Napoleon. 教授写了一部有关拿破仑的巨著。

name: lull
interpret: vt. 使平静；使安静；哄骗 vi. 平息；减弱；停止 n. 间歇；暂停；暂时平静
example: 单词 lull 的例句||||The drug put Simpson in a lull for thirty minutes. 药物使辛普森安静了30分钟。||||Ground fighting flared up again after a two-week lull. 经过两个星期的平静之后，地面战又突然爆发了。

name: glaze
interpret: vt. 装以玻璃；上釉于 vi. 变呆滞；变得光滑 n. 釉；光滑面
example: 单词 glaze 的例句||||Brush the glaze over the top and sides of the hot cake. 在热蛋糕的顶上和周围刷上一层蛋浆。||||Tang three-color glaze horses are famous for their perfect design and realism. 唐三彩上釉马以其造型精美和形态生动而著名。

name: disinterested
example: 单词 disinterested 的例句||||He is impartial and disinterested. 他公正无私。|||| He's always on the make, I have never known him do a disinterested action. 他这个人一贯都是唯利是图，我从来不知道他有什么无私的行动。

name: contingency
example: 单词 contingency 的例句||||We should be prepared for any contingency. 我们应该对任何应急情况有所准备。||||A fire in our warehouse was a contingency that we had not expected. 库房的一场大火是我们始料未及的。

name: dodge
interpret: n. 躲闪；托词 vt. 躲避，避开 vi. 躲避，避开
example: 单词 dodge 的例句||||A dodge behind a tree kept her from being run over. 她向树后一闪，才没被车从身上辗过。||||The dodge was coopered by the police. 诡计被警察粉碎了。

name: dismal
interpret: adj.阴沉的，凄凉的，令人忧郁的，差劲的
example: 单词 dismal 的例句||||That is a rather dismal melody. 那是一支相当忧郁的歌曲。||||My prospects of returning to a suitable job are dismal. 我重新找到一个合适的工作岗位的希望很渺茫。

name: inflate
interpret: vt.使膨胀，使骄傲，抬高（物价）
example: 单词 inflate 的例句||||The buyers bid against each other and often inflate the prices they pay. 买主们竞相投标，往往人为地提高价钱。||||Stuart jumped into the sea and inflated the liferaft. 斯图尔特跳到海里给救生艇充气。

name: pervade
interpret: vt.弥漫，遍及，充满，渗透，漫延
example: 单词 pervade 的例句||||Science and technology have come to pervade every aspect of our lives. 科学和技术已经渗透到我们生活的每一个方面。||||The smell of sawdust and glue pervaded the factory. 工厂里弥漫着锯屑和胶水的气味。

name: supervision
example: 单词 supervision 的例句||||The work was done under my supervision. 这项工作是在我的监督之下完成的。||||The old man's will was executed under the personal supervision of the lawyer. 老人的遗嘱是在律师的亲自监督下执行的。

name: muster
interpret: vt. 召集；对…进行点名；使振作 n. 集合；检阅；点名册；集合人员 vi. 召集；聚集
example: 单词 muster 的例句||||Go and muster all the men you can find. 去集合所有你能找到的人。||||I had to muster my courage up to ask him that question. 我必须鼓起勇气向他问那个问题。

name: amass
example: 单词 amass 的例句||||How had he amassed his fortune? 他是如何积累财富的呢？||||The capitalists amass great wealth by exploiting workers. 资本家剥削工人而积累了巨额财富。

name: tribal
example: 单词 tribal 的例句||||He became skilled in several tribal lingoes. 他精通几种部族的语言。||||The country was torn apart by fierce tribal hostilities. 那个国家被部落间的激烈冲突弄得四分五裂。

name: envious
example: 单词 envious 的例句||||I don't think I'm envious of your success. 我想我并不嫉妒你的成功。||||She is envious of Jane's good looks and covetous of her car. 她既忌妒简的美貌又垂涎她的汽车。

name: relentless
interpret: adj.残酷的，不留情的，无怜悯心的
example: 单词 relentless 的例句||||The traffic noise is relentless. 交通车辆的噪音一刻也不停止。||||Their training has to be relentless. 他们的训练必须是无情的。

name: languish
interpret: vi.变得衰弱无力，失去活力，（植物等）凋萎
example: 单词 languish 的例句||||Without the founder's drive and direction, the company gradually languished. 没有了创始人的斗志与指引，公司逐渐走向没落。|||| New products languish on the drawing board. 新产品在计划阶段即告失败。

name: rigor
example: 单词 rigor 的例句||||Their analysis lacks rigor. 他们的分析缺乏严谨性。||The crime will be treated with the full rigor of the law. 这一罪行会严格依法审理。

name: chasm
interpret: n.深坑，断层，裂口，大分岐，利害冲突
example: 单词 chasm 的例句||||There's a chasm between rich and poor in that society. 那社会中存在着贫富差距。||||A huge chasm gaped before them. 他们面前有个巨大的裂痕。

name: redeem
interpret: vt.买回，赎回，挽回，恢复，履行（诺言等）
example: 单词 redeem 的例句||||He had no way to redeem his furniture out of pawn. 他无法赎回典当的家具。||||The eyes redeem the face from ugliness. 这双眼睛弥补了他其貌不扬之缺陷。

name: crumple
interpret: vt. 弄皱；使一蹶不振 vi. 起皱；倒坍；一蹶不振 n. 皱纹；褶皱
example: 单词 crumple 的例句||||Take care not to crumple your dress by packing it carelessly. 当心不要因收放粗心压皱你的衣服。||||The wall was likely to crumple up at any time. 墙随时可能坍掉。

name: deplete
interpret: vt.弄空，排除，减轻，减少...体液，放去...的血
example: 单词 deplete 的例句||||Most native mammal species have been severely depleted. 大多数本地哺乳动物的数量都已经大大减少了。||||Elastic collisions deplete very little of the electron's energy. 弹性碰撞中电子减少的能量非常少。

name: sanity
interpret: n.心智健全，神智正常，判断正确
example: 单词 sanity 的例句||||I doubt the sanity of such a plan. 我怀疑这个计划是否明智。||||She managed to keep her sanity throughout the ordeal. 在那场磨难中她始终保持神志正常。

name: majestic
interpret: adj.雄伟的，壮丽的，庄严的，威严的，崇高的
example: 单词 majestic 的例句||||In the distance rose the majestic Alps. 远处耸立着雄伟的阿尔卑斯山。||||He looks majestic in uniform. 他穿上军装显得很威风。

name: maternal
interpret: adj.母亲的，母亲般的，母系的，母方的
example: 单词 maternal 的例句||||He is my maternal uncle. 他是我舅舅。||||The sight of the hopeless little boy aroused her maternal instincts. 那个绝望的小男孩的模样唤起了她的母性。

name: lobster
example: 单词 lobster 的例句||||The lobster is a shellfish. 龙虾是水生贝壳动物。|||| I like lobster but it does not like me. 我喜欢吃龙虾，但它不适宜于我的健康。

name: conspire
interpret: vi. 共谋；协力 vt. [法] 密谋策划
example: 单词 conspire 的例句||||They'd conspired to overthrow the government. 他们曾经密谋推翻政府。||||History and geography have conspired to bring Greece to a moment of decision. 历史和地理因素共同将希腊推至作出抉择的紧要关头。

name: seduce
example: 单词 seduce 的例句||||She has set out to seduce Stephen. 她已经开始勾引斯蒂芬了。||||Clever advertising would seduce more people into smoking. 巧妙策划的广告会引诱更多的人吸烟。

name: cigaret
example: 单词 cigaret 的例句||||I like having cigaret with my drink. 我喝酒时喜欢抽烟。||||He lit a cigaret in order to calm his mind. 他点燃一支香烟，镇定一下情绪。

name: relinquish
example: 单词 relinquish 的例句||||He was forced to relinquish control of the company. 他被迫放弃公司的掌控权。||||They will never voluntarily relinquish their independence. 他们绝对不会自动放弃独立。

name: assortment
interpret: n.分类，各色俱备之物，聚集
example: 单词 assortment 的例句||||This shop has a good assortment of goods to choose from. 该店各色货物俱全，任君选择。||||She was wearing an odd assortment of clothes. 她穿着奇装异服。

name: ravage
interpret: vt.使...荒废，破坏...；n.破坏，掠夺，荒废
example: 单词 ravage 的例句||||Just in time to watch a plague ravage his village. 恰好目睹了瘟疫毁灭了他的村庄。||||For two decades the country has been ravaged by civil war and foreign intervention. 20年来，这个国家一直被内战外侵所蹂躏。

name: accomplice
example: 单词 accomplice 的例句||||She was her husband's accomplice in murdering a rich old man. 她是她丈夫谋杀一个老富翁的帮凶。||||He is suspected as an accomplice of the murder. 他涉嫌为这次凶杀案的同谋。

name: imprisonment
example: 单词 imprisonment 的例句||||His sentence was commuted from death to life imprisonment. 他的判决由死刑减为无期徒刑。||||He was sentenced to one year's imprisonment for committing bigamy. 他因为犯重婚罪被判入狱一年。

name: eventual
example: 单词 eventual 的例句||||Several schools face eventual closure. 几所学校面临最终关闭。||||Both parties expressed optimism about an eventual solution. 双方对问题的最终解决都表示乐观。

name: elasticity
example: 单词 elasticity 的例句||||The skin eventually loses its elasticity. 皮肤最终会失去弹性。||||Every sort of spring has a definite elasticity. 每一种弹簧都有一定的弹性。

name: drench
example: 单词 drench 的例句||||He met a drench of rain. 他遇上一场倾盆大雨。||||They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them. 他们将消防水管对着人们，把他们浇了个透。

name: dispel
example: 单词 dispel 的例句||||I tried in vain to dispel her misgivings. 我试图消除她的疑虑，但没有成功。||||We hope the programme will dispel certain misconceptions about the disease. 我们希望这个节目能消除对这种疾病的一些误解。

name: dilate
example: 单词 dilate 的例句||||At night, the pupils dilate to allow in more light. 到了晚上，瞳孔就会扩大以接收更多光线。||||Exercise dilates blood vessels on the surface of the brain. 运动会使大脑表层的血管扩张。

name: devastate
example: 单词 devastate 的例句||||A few days before, a fire had devastated large parts of Windsor Castle. 几天前，温莎城堡的大部分被一场大火烧毁。||||Earthquakes can also cause tsunamis, which devastate coastal regions. 地震还引发海啸，它直接破坏海岸地区。

name: dependence
interpret: n.依靠，依赖；信任，信赖；隶属
example: 单词 dependence 的例句||||Doctors keep trying to break her dependence of the drug. 医生们尽力使她戒除毒瘾。||||He was freed from financial dependence on his parents. 他在经济上摆脱了对父母的依赖。

name: depreciation
interpret: n.价值低落，贬值，蔑视，贬低
example: 单词 depreciation 的例句||||She can't bear the depreciation of the enemy. 她受不了敌人的蹂躏。||||They wrote off 500 for depreciation of machinery. 他们注销了500镑作为机器折旧费。

name: debtor
example: 单词 debtor 的例句||||He crowded the debtor for payment. 他催逼负债人还债。||||The court granted me a lien on my debtor's property. 法庭授予我对我债务人财产的留置权。

name: deft
interpret: adj.灵巧的，熟练的（a deft hand 能手）
example: 单词 deft 的例句||||The pianist has deft fingers. 钢琴家有灵巧的双手。||||This bird, sharp of eye and deft of beak, can accurately peck the flying insects in the air. 这只鸟眼疾嘴快，能准确地把空中的飞虫啄住。

name: creditor
example: 单词 creditor 的例句||||The boss assigned his car to his creditor. 那工头把自己的小汽车让与了债权人。||||I had to run away from my creditor whom I made a usurious loan. 我借了高利贷不得不四处躲债。

name: contractor
example: 单词 contractor 的例句||||The Tokyo contractor was asked to kick $6000 back as commission. 那个东京的承包商被要求退还6000美元作为佣金。||||The style of house the contractor builds depends partly on the lay of the land. 承包商所建房屋的式样，有几分要看地势而定。

name: consign
interpret: vt.寄售（货品），托运，交托，委托
example: 单词 consign 的例句||||We cannot agree to consign the goods. 我们不同意寄售此货。||||We will consign the goods to him by express. 我们将以快递把货物寄给他。

name: barter
interpret: n.物物交换，以货易货，实物交易
example: 单词 barter 的例句||||Chickens, goats and rabbits were offered for barter at the bazaar. 在集市上，鸡、山羊和兔子被摆出来作物物交换之用。||||They have arranged food imports on a barter basis. 他们以易货贸易的方式安排食品进口。

name: astound
example: 单词 astound 的例句||||His practical grasp of affairs and his energy still astound me. 他对事物的实际掌握和他充沛的精力实在使我惊异。||||He used to astound his friends with feats of physical endurance. 过去，他表现出来的惊人耐力常让朋友们大吃一惊。

name: appraise
example: 单词 appraise 的例句||||An expert came to appraise the value of my antiques. 一位专家来对我的古玩作了估价。||||It is very high that people appraise to his thesis. 人们对他的论文评价很高。

name: animate
interpret: vt.赋于生命，鼓励；adj.有生命的，有生气的
example: 单词 animate 的例句||||We are animate beings, living creatures. 我们是有生命的存在，有生命的动物。||||The girls watched, little teasing smiles animating their faces. 女孩们注视着，脸上挂着调皮的微笑，显得愈加活泼。

name: affinity
example: 单词 affinity 的例句||||I felt a great affinity with the people of the Highlands. 我被苏格兰高地人民深深地吸引。||||It's important that you share an affinity with your husband. 和丈夫有共同的爱好是十分重要的。

name: adamant
example: 单词 adamant 的例句||||We are adamant on the building of a well-off society. 在建设小康社会这一点上，我们是坚定不移的。||||Veronica was quite adamant that they should stay on. 维罗妮卡坚信他们必须继续留下去。

name: obliterate
interpret: vt.擦去，涂抹，去掉...痕迹，消失，除去
example: 单词 obliterate 的例句||||Whole villages were obliterated by fire. 整座整座的村庄都被大火所吞噬。||||There was time enough to obliterate memories of how things once were for him. 时间足以抹去他对过去经历的记忆。

name: gape
interpret: vi. 裂开，张开；打呵欠 n. 裂口，张嘴；呵欠
example: 单词 gape 的例句||||His secretary stopped taking notes to gape at me. 他的秘书停止了记录，目瞪口呆地望着我。||||He was not the type to wander round gaping at everything like a tourist. 他不是那种像个游客似的四处闲逛、对什么都好奇张望的人。

name: banking
example: 单词 banking 的例句||||John is launching his son on a career in banking. 约翰打算让儿子在银行界谋一个新职位。||||He possesses an extensive knowledge of banking. 他具有广博的银行业务知识。

name: antagonist
example: 单词 antagonist 的例句||||His antagonist in the debate was quicker than he. 在辩论中他的对手比他反应快。||||The thing is to know the nature of your antagonist. 要紧的是要了解你的对手的特性。

name: havoc
interpret: n.大破坏，浩劫，大混乱，大杂乱
example: 单词 havoc 的例句||||The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city. 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。||||This concentration of airborne firepower wrought havoc with the enemy forces. 这次机载火力的集中攻击给敌军造成很大破坏。

name: insidious
interpret: adj.阴险的，隐匿的，暗中为害的，（疾病）不知不觉之间加剧
example: 单词 insidious 的例句||||That insidious man bad-mouthed me to almost everyone else. 那个阴险的家伙几乎见人便说我的坏话。||||Organized crime has an insidious influence on all who come into contact with it. 所有和集团犯罪有关的人都会不知不觉地受坏影响。

name: frugal
interpret: adj.节俭的，节约的，少量的，微量的
example: 单词 frugal 的例句||||He was a VIP, but he had a frugal life. 他是位要人，但生活俭朴。||||The old woman is frugal to the extreme. 那老妇人节约到了极点。

name: concur
interpret: vi.同意，意见一致，互助，同时发生
example: 单词 concur 的例句||||Wealth and happiness do not always concur. 财富与幸福并非总是并存的。||||I concur with the speaker in condemning what has been done. 我同意发言者对所做的事加以谴责。

name: parity
example: 单词 parity 的例句||||The two currencies have now reached parity. 这两种货币现已达到同等价值。||||Women have yet to achieve wage or occupational parity in many fields. 女性在很多领域还没能争取到薪金、职位方面的平等。

name: stature
interpret: n.（高度）水平，（高度）境界，身高，身材
example: 单词 stature 的例句||||He is five feet five inches in stature. 他身高5英尺5英寸。||||The dress models are tall of stature. 时装模特儿的身材都较高。

name: crave
interpret: vt.渴望得到，迫切需要，恳求，请求
example: 单词 crave 的例句||||Many young children crave attention. 许多小孩子渴望得到关心。||||You may be craving for some fresh air. 你可能很想呼吸呼吸新鲜空气。

name: serenity
example: 单词 serenity 的例句||||Her face, though sad, still evoked a feeling of serenity. 她的脸色虽然悲伤，但仍使人感觉安详。||||She escaped to the comparative serenity of the kitchen. 她逃到相对安静的厨房里。

name: inept
interpret: adj.不恰当的，荒谬的，拙劣的
example: 单词 inept 的例句||||Whan an inept remark to make on such a formal occasion. 在如此正式的场合，怎么说这样不恰当的话。|||| He's quite inept at tennis. 他打网球太笨。

name: brawl
interpret: n.大声争吵，喧嚷；v.吵架，对骂
example: 单词 brawl 的例句||||They had nothing better to do than brawl in the street. 他们除了在街上斗殴做不出什么好事。||||I don't want to see our two neighbours engaged in a brawl. 我不希望我们两家吵架吵得不可开交。

name: foresight
example: 单词 foresight 的例句||||The failure is the result of our lack of foresight. 这次失败是由于我们缺乏远虑而造成的。||||It required a statesman's foresight and sagacity to make the decision. 作出这个决定需要政治家的远见卓识。

name: prosecution
interpret: n.起诉，告发，检举，执行，经营
example: 单词 prosecution 的例句||||The Smiths brought a prosecution against the organizers. 史密斯家对组织者们提出起诉。||||He attempts to rebut the assertion made by the prosecution witness. 他试图反驳原告方证人所作的断言。

name: serene
interpret: adj. 安详的，宁静的，平静的
example: 单词 serene 的例句||||He has entered the serene autumn of his life. 他已进入了美好的中年时期。||||He didn't speak much, he just smiled with that serene smile of his. 他话不多，只是脸上露出他招牌式的淡定的微笑。

name: tactic
interpret: n.战略，策略；adj.战术的，有策略的
example: 单词 tactic 的例句||||Reducing prices is a common sales tactic. 降价是常用的销售策略。||||She had often used the tactic of threatening to resign. 她惯用以辞职相威胁的手法。

name: scour
interpret: vi. 冲刷；擦；腹泻 vt. 擦亮，洗涤；冲洗，清除 n. 擦，冲刷；洗涤剂
example: 单词 scour 的例句||||Mother made me scour the family silver. 母亲让我擦洗家里的银器。||||We scoured the telephone directory for clues. 我们仔细查阅电话簿以寻找线索。

name: plank
interpret: n.板条，木板，政策要点，政纲条目
example: 单词 plank 的例句||||The plank was set against the wall. 木板靠着墙壁。||||They intend to win the next election on the plank of developing trade. 他们想以发展贸易的纲领来赢得下次选举。

name: ration
interpret: n.定量(pl.)给养，口粮；vt.定量供应
example: 单词 ration 的例句||||The country cut the bread ration last year. 那个国家去年削减面包配给量。||||We have to ration the water. 我们必须限量用水。

name: salvage
interpret: vt.救助，营救，援救；n.救助，营救
example: 单词 salvage 的例句||||All attempts to salvage the wrecked ship failed. 抢救失事船只的一切努力都失败了。||||The salvage was piled upon the pier. 抢救出的财产被堆放在码头上。

name: picturesque
interpret: adj.美丽如画的，（语言）生动的，绘声绘色的
example: 单词 picturesque 的例句||||You can see the picturesque shores beside the river. 在河边你可以看到景色如画的两岸。||||That was a picturesque phrase. 那是一个形象化的说法。

name: oust
example: 单词 oust 的例句||||The committee wanted to oust him from the union. 委员会想把他从工会中驱逐出去。||||The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists. 这些领导人被民族主义者赶下了台。

name: mattress
example: 单词 mattress 的例句||||The straw mattress needs to be aired. 草垫子该晾一晾了。||||The new mattress I bought sags in the middle. 我买的新床垫中间陷了下去。

name: negligence
example: 单词 negligence 的例句||||They charged him with negligence of duty. 他们指责他玩忽职守。||||The traffic accident was allegedly due to negligence. 这次车祸据说是由于疏忽造成的。

name: intoxicate
interpret: vt.使喝醉，使陶醉，使欣喜若狂
example: 单词 intoxicate 的例句||||Wine has the power to intoxicate. 酒能醉人。|||| Cherishing a rose means to intoxicate yourself on her beauty more than pull her throns out. 喜欢玫瑰意思是要我们陶醉它的美丽，而不是去除它的刺。

name: infamous
interpret: adj.声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的，邪恶的
example: 单词 infamous 的例句||||He was infamous for his anti-feminist attitudes. 他因反对女性主义而声名狼藉。||||I was shocked by her infamous behaviour. 她的无耻行径令我震惊。

name: incessant
example: 单词 incessant 的例句||||We have had incessant snowfall since yesterday afternoon. 从昨天下午开始就持续不断地下雪。||||She is tired of his incessant demands for affection. 她厌倦了他对感情的不断索取。

name: impede
example: 单词 impede 的例句||||One shouldn't impede other's progress. 一个人不应该妨碍他人进步。||||The muddy roads impede our journey. 我们的旅游被泥泞的道路阻挠了。

name: grudge
interpret: n.不满，怨恨，妒嫉；vt.勉强给，不情愿做
example: 单词 grudge 的例句||||I grudge paying so much for such inferior goods. 我不愿花这么多钱买次品。||||I do not grudge him his success. 我不嫉妒他的成功。

name: imminent
interpret: adj.即将发生的，临近的，逼近的
example: 单词 imminent 的例句||||The black clouds show that a storm is imminent. 乌云预示暴风雨即将来临。||||The country is in imminent danger. 国难当头。

name: hereditary
interpret: adj.遗传的，遗传性的，可继承的，世袭的
example: 单词 hereditary 的例句||||The Queen of England is a hereditary ruler. 英国女王是世袭的统治者。||||In men, hair loss is hereditary. 男性脱发属于遗传。

name: graft
interpret: n.移植，嫁接，艰苦工作，贪污；v.移植，嫁接
example: 单词 graft 的例句||||I am having a skin graft on my arm soon. 我马上就要接受手臂的皮肤移植手术。||||The minister became rich through graft. 这位部长透过贪污受贿致富。

name: forgery
interpret: n.伪造的文件等，赝品，伪造（行为）
example: 单词 forgery 的例句||||The painting was a forgery. 这张画是赝品。||||He was sent to prison for forgery. 他因伪造罪而被关进监狱。

name: foliage
example: 单词 foliage 的例句||||The path was completely covered by the dense foliage. 小路被树叶厚厚地盖了一层。||||Dark foliage clothes the hills. 浓密的树叶覆盖着群山。

name: foe
example: 单词 foe 的例句||||He knew that Karl could be an implacable foe. 他明白卡尔可能会成为他的死敌。||||A friend is a friend, a foe is a foe. One must be clearly distinguished from the other. 敌是敌，友是友，必须分清界限。

name: disdain
interpret: n.鄙视，轻视；v.轻视，鄙视，不屑
example: 单词 disdain 的例句||||Some people disdain labour. 有些人轻视劳动。||||A great man should disdain flatterers. 伟大的人物应鄙视献媚者。

name: discord
interpret: n.不和，意见不合，争论，（音乐）不和谐
example: 单词 discord 的例句||||These two answers are in discord. 这两个答案不一样。||||The discord of his music was hard on the ear. 他演奏的不和谐音很刺耳。

name: equity
interpret: n.公正，公平，（无固定利息的）股票
example: 单词 equity 的例句||||They shared the work of the house with equity. 他们公平地分担家务。||||To capture his equity, Murphy must either sell or refinance. 要获得资产净值，墨菲必须出售或者重新融资。

name: fiscal
interpret: adj.财政的，会计的，国库的，国库岁入的
example: 单词 fiscal 的例句||||The increase of taxation is an important fiscal policy. 增税是一项重要的财政政策。||||The government has two basic strategies of fiscal policy available. 政府有两个可行的财政政策基本战略。

name: dabble
interpret: vt. 溅湿；浸入水中 vi. 涉猎；涉足；玩水
example: 单词 dabble 的例句||||They dabble in the stock market. 他们少量投资于股市。||||Never dabble with things of which you have no knowledge. 绝不要插手你不了解的事物。
